required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Specialize Dysphagia Training and Knowledge/Competency of Nurses
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Specialized Dysphagia Training on Knowledge and Competency of Nurses

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this research is to determine the effect of specialized dysphagia training on knowledge and competency of nurses.

primary_outcome.measure: Nurses Knowledge and competency regarding dysphagia scale
primary_outcome.description: Change from base line, Nurses knowledge and competency regarding dysphagia scale is self developed scale. The scale include items related to anatomy physiology, risk factors, sign and symptoms, complications, screening, and management measured on 11 point scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Nurses Knowledge and competency regarding dysphagia scale
primary_outcome.description: Change from base line to follow up of 3 months, Nurses knowledge and competency regarding dysphagia scale is self developed scale. The scale include items related to anatomy physiology, risk factors, sign and symptoms, complications, screening, and management measured on 11 point scale.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline, The simulation design scale is twenty item five point scale. It is used to evaluate design features of simulation. The instrument is divided into two parts: one part is about the presence of specific features in the simulation, while the other part is about the importance of those features to the learner. The rating of the specific features is from 1 to 5 where 1 is strongly disagree with the statement and 5 is strongly agree with the statement. Importance part is rated from 1 to 5 where 1 is not important and 5 is very important

Changes from baseline, Educational practice questionnaire consists of sixteen items and is five point scale. It is used to measure educational practices. The rating of the educational practices is from 1 to 5 where 1 is strongly disagree with the statement and 5 is strongly agree with the statement. Importance part is rated from 1 to 5 where 1 is not important and 5 is very important

secondary_outcome.measure: Student satisfaction and self confidence in learning
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline, Student satisfaction and self confidence in learning is 13 item scale and is used to measure students satisfaction with simulation activity and self confidence in learning. Student satisfaction and self confidence in learning is rated from 1 to 5 where 1 is strongly disagree with the statement and 5 as strongly agree with the statement

arm_group.description: Power point presentation covering material related to nursing evaluation and caring of dysphagia patients. Stimulation session with nurses to practice screening skill
Reading material covering information related to nursing evaluation and caring of dysphagia patient

intervention.description: Training using PowerPoint and simulation. Training includes anatomy physiology, screening and management sections. Simulation will be used for practice. Reading material will also be provided
Reading material provided to nurses covering knowledge related to nursing evaluation and caring for dysphagia patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Nurses of both gender
- At least one year of experience
- Nurses working at Govt. hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Undergraduate nursed working as intern at hospital
